snippet: An impasse over Syria and fractious domestic politics in both countries have underscored the limits of President Obama’s ability to “reset” ties between the nations.
abstract: Vladimir V Putin's return to the Kremlin has ushered in a frostier relationship with the United States freighted by an impasse over Syria and complicated by fractious domestic politics in both countries; souring relations come just as President Obama and Putin are preparing to meet for the first time as presidents next week on the sidelines of a summit meeting in Mexico.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow, and Thom Shanker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An impasse over Syria and fractious domestic politics in both countries have underscored the limits of President Obama’s ability to “reset” ties between the nations.

headline.seo: Putin’s Return Brings Rapid Chill to U.S.-Russia Ties
headline.main: Syria Crisis and Putin’s Return Chill U.S. Ties With Russia
headline.print_headline: As Putin Returns and Syria Boils, U.S.-Russia Ties Sour
